author: Jeff Geerling
description:
Minisforum just launched the MS-R1, their first Arm workstation PC.

Will it bring Arm into the homelab, in a big way? Or will it suffer the same fate as the Radxa Orion O6, let down by a power-hungry SoC? And will a dedicated GPU fit inside this tiny box?

Things mentioned in this video (amzn.to links are affiliate links):

  - Minisforum MS-R1: https://s.minisforum.com/4hRFZbj
  - MS-R1 benchmarks and test data: https://github.com/geerlingguy/sbc-reviews/issues/89
  - Radxa Orion O6 review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OMnCqmM-WKo
  - Abovetop Nvidia RTX A2000 SFF GPU: https://www.newegg.com/abovetop-Model-A2000laptop/p/1DW-00MF-00001
  - Intel Arc A310 ECO GPU: https://amzn.to/49Q3vn4

00:00 - Hardware overv
title: Arm Homelab-in-a-Box – Minisforum MS-R1
